member.name: T:AV.Core.Commands.CommandManager
member.summary: Provides the MediEngine with an API to execute media control commands. Direct Commands execute immediately (Open, CLose, Change) Priority Commands execute in the queue but before anything else and are exclusive (Play, Pause, Stop) Seek commands are queued and replaced. These are processed in a deferred manner by this worker.

member.name: M:AV.Core.Commands.CommandManager.#ctor(AV.Core.Engine.MediaEngine)
member.summary: Initialises a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets the media engine state.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Commands.CommandManager.PendingPriorityCommand
member.summary: Gets the pending priority command. There can only be one at a time.

member.name: M:AV.Core.Commands.CommandManager.OpenMediaAsync(System.Uri)
member.summary: Opens the media using a standard URI.
member.returns: An awaitable task which contains a boolean whether or not to resume media when completed.

member.summary: Opens the media using a custom stream.
member.returns: An awaitable task which contains a boolean whether or not to resume media when completed.

member.name: M:AV.Core.Commands.CommandManager.CloseMediaAsync
member.summary: Closes the currently open media.
member.returns: An awaitable task which contains a boolean whether or not to resume media when completed.

member.name: M:AV.Core.Commands.CommandManager.ChangeMediaAsync
member.summary: Changes the media components and applies new configuration.
member.returns: An awaitable task which contains a boolean whether or not to resume media when completed.

member.name: M:AV.Core.Commands.CommandManager.PlayMediaAsync
member.summary: Plays the currently open media.
member.returns: An awaitable task which contains a boolean result. True means success. False means failure.

member.name: M:AV.Core.Commands.CommandManager.PauseMediaAsync
member.summary: Pauses the currently open media asynchronous.
member.returns: An awaitable task which contains a boolean result. True means success. False means failure.

member.name: M:AV.Core.Commands.CommandManager.StopMediaAsync
member.summary: Stops the currently open media. This seeks to the start of the input and pauses the clock.
member.returns: An awaitable task which contains a boolean result. True means success. False means failure.

member.name: M:AV.Core.Commands.CommandManager.SeekMediaAsync(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Queues a seek operation.
member.returns: An awaitable task which contains a boolean result. True means success. False means failure.

member.summary: Queues a seek operation that steps a single frame forward.
member.returns: An awaitable task which contains a boolean result. True means success. False means failure.

member.name: M:AV.Core.Commands.CommandManager.StepBackwardAsync
member.summary: Queues a seek operation that steps a single frame backward.
member.returns: An awaitable task which contains a boolean result. True means success. False means failure.

member.summary: The libavformat library provides some generic global options, which can be set on all the muxers and demuxers. For additional information, please see: https://ffmpeg.org/ffmpeg-formats.html#Format-Options Geek Stuff: https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/blob/a0ac49e38ee1d1011c394d7be67d0f08b2281526/libavformat/options_table.h#L36.

member.summary: Initialises a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.DemuxerGlobalOptions.EnableReducedBuffering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable reduced buffering.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.DemuxerGlobalOptions.ProbeSize
member.summary: Gets or sets probing size in bytes, i.e. the size of the data to analyze to get stream information. A higher value will enable detecting more information in case it is dispersed into the stream, but will increase latency. Must be an integer not lesser than 32. It is 5000000 by default.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.DemuxerGlobalOptions.PacketSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the packet size.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagIgnoreIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the ignore index. Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagEnableFastSeek
member.summary: Enable fast, but inaccurate seeks for some formats. Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagGeneratePts
member.summary: Generate PTS. Port of genpts.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagEnableNoFillIn
member.summary: Do not fill in missing values that can be exactly calculated. Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagIgnoreDts
member.summary: Ignore DTS. Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagDiscardCorrupt
member.summary: Discard corrupted frames. Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagSortDts
member.summary: Try to interleave output packets by DTS. Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagKeepSideData
member.summary: Do not merge side data. Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagEnableLatmPayload
member.summary: Enable RTP MP4A-LATM payload. Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagNoBuffer
member.summary: Reduce the latency introduced by optional buffering Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagStopAtShortest
member.summary: Stop muxing at the end of the shortest stream. It may be needed to increase max_interleave_delta to avoid flushing the longer streams before EOF. Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.DemuxerGlobalOptions.SeekToAny
member.summary: Allow seeking to non-keyframes on demuxer level when supported if set to 1. Default is 0.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.DemuxerGlobalOptions.MaxAnalyzeDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum duration to be analyzed before identifying stream information. In realtime streams this can be reduced to reduce latency (i.e. TimeSpan.Zero).

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.DemuxerGlobalOptions.CryptoKey
member.summary: Set decryption key. A hexadecimal string without the prefixes (0x) or suffixes (h) needs to be provided.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.DemuxerGlobalOptions.ProtocolWhitelist
member.summary: Gets or sets the protocol whitelist. The values must be separated by comma. Example: file,http,https,tcp,tls.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of video blocks to cache in the decoder. Leave as -1 for auto. Please note that increasing the amount of blocks, significantly increases RAM usage.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of audio blocks to cache in the decoder. Leave as -1 for auto. Please note that increasing the amount of blocks, significantly increases RAM usage.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of audio blocks to cache in the decoder. Leave as -1 for auto. Please note that increasing the amount of blocks, significantly increases RAM usage.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.MediaOptions.IsTimeSyncDisabled
member.summary: Only recommended for live streams. Gets or sets a value indicating whether each component needs to run its timing independently. This property is useful when for example when the audio and the video components of the stream have no timing relationship or when you don't need the components to be synchronized between them.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.MediaOptions.MinimumPlaybackBufferPercent
member.summary: Typically, and especially for live streams, you want to wait for some packet data to become available before resuming playback. The buffer percent represents 1 second of data for each component -- excluding subtitles. Valid range is from 0.0 (do not wait for packet data) to 1.0 (wait for 1 second on each component. This defaults to 0.5 which is suitable for most live streams.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.MediaOptions.UseParallelDecoding
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether component frames are decoded in parallel. This defaults to false but it is enabled automatically when is enabled.

member.name: P:AV.Core.Common.MediaOptions.UseParallelRendering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether component blocks are sent to their corresponding renderers in parallel. This defaults to false.

member.name: T:AV.Core.Container.MediaBlock
member.summary: A base class for blocks of the different MediaTypes. Blocks are the result of decoding and scaling a frame. Blocks have pre-allocated buffers which makes them memory and CPU efficient. Reuse blocks as much as possible. Once you create a block from a frame, you don't need the frame anymore so make sure you dispose the frame.

member.name: M:AV.Core.Container.MediaBlockBuffer.IndexOf(System.Int64)
member.summary: Retrieves the index of the playback block corresponding to the specified render time. This uses very fast binary and linear search combinations. If there are no playback blocks it returns -1. If the render time is greater than the range end time, it returns the last playback block index. If the render time is less than the range start time, it returns the first playback block index.

member.name: T:AV.Core.Container.MediaContainer
member.summary: A container capable of opening an input url, reading packets from it, decoding frames, seeking, and pausing and resuming network streams Code based on https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/release/3.2/ffplay.c The method pipeline should be: 1. Set Options (or don't, for automatic options) and Initialize, 2. Perform continuous packet reads, 3. Perform continuous frame decodes 4. Perform continuous block materialization.

member.name: M:AV.Core.Container.MediaContainer.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes the container and its input context, extracting stream information. Container configuration passed on the constructor is applied. This method must be called to make the container usable.

member.name: M:AV.Core.Container.MediaContainer.Open
member.summary: Opens the individual stream components on the existing input context in order to start reading packets. Any Media Options must be set before this method is called.

member.name: M:AV.Core.Container.MediaContainer.Seek(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Seeks to the specified position in the main stream component. Returns the keyframe on or before the specified position. Most of the times you will need to keep reading packets and receiving frames to reach the exact position. Pass TimeSpan.MinValue to seek to the beginning of the stream.
member.exception: No input context initialized.

member.name: M:AV.Core.Container.MediaContainer.Read
member.summary: Reads the next available packet, sending the packet to the corresponding internal media component. It also sets IsAtEndOfStream property. Returns the media type if the packet was accepted by any of the media components. Returns None if the packet was not accepted by any of the media components or if reading failed (i.e. End of stream already or read error). Packets are queued internally. To dequeue them you need to call the receive frames method of each component until the packet buffer count becomes 0.
member.returns: The media type of the packet that was read.
member.exception: No input context initialized.
When a read error occurs.

member.name: M:AV.Core.Container.MediaContainer.Decode
member.summary: Decodes the next available packet in the packet queue for each of the components. Returns the list of decoded frames. The list of 0 or more decoded frames is returned in ascending StartTime order. A Packet may contain 0 or more frames. Once the frame source objects are returned, you are responsible for calling the Dispose method on them to free the underlying FFmpeg frame. Note that even after releasing them you can still use the managed properties. If you intend on Converting the frames to usable media frames (with Convert) you must not release the frame. Specify the release input argument as true and the frame will be automatically freed from memory.

member.name: M:AV.Core.Container.MediaContainer.Convert(AV.Core.Container.MediaFrame,AV.Core.Container.MediaBlock@,System.Boolean,AV.Core.Container.MediaBlock)
member.summary: Performs audio, video and subtitle conversions on the decoded input frame so data can be used as a Frame. Please note that if the output is passed as a reference. This works as follows: if the output reference is null it will be automatically instantiated and returned by this function. This enables to either instantiate or reuse a previously allocated Frame. This is important because buffer allocations are expensive operations and this allows you to perform the allocation once and continue reusing the same buffer.
member.param: The raw frame source. Has to be compatible with the target. (e.g. use VideoFrameSource to convert to VideoFrame).
The target frame. Has to be compatible with the source.
if set to true releases the raw frame source from unmanaged memory.
The previous block from which to extract timing information in case it is missing.
member.exception: No input context initialized.
MediaType.
input.
input or input.

member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.FFInterop.Initialize(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Registers FFmpeg library and initializes its components. It only needs to be called once but calling it more than once has no effect. Returns the path that FFmpeg was registered from. This method is thread-safe.
member.param: The bit-wise flag identifiers corresponding to the libraries.
member.returns: Returns true if it was a new initialization and it succeeded. False if there was no need to initialize as there is already a valid initialization.
member.exception: When ffmpeg libraries are not found.
